title: Content Access Optimization Strategies in Blended Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Practical experience in language education and proficiency in basic digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Environment enabling current practitioners to improve language skills considering job relevance, with situational conversation practice and feedback in simulation/VR environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze access patterns of four content types (core materials, direct support, indirect support, supplementary resources) in blended learning environments.
Learners can establish content utilization strategies during simulation/VR-based task performance to achieve a target success rate of 80% or higher.
Learners can propose personalized learning strategies through content access log analysis during project-based assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
